job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Lovely people and really great students
cons: Compensation is overall, atrocious in comparison to other similarly sized public universities. The benefits system is also very odd. You are awarded 14 PTO hours per month, but what HR doesn't tell you is that over the summer you will be REQUIRED to leave an hour early, and whether or not you do, you will have one hour per day docked from your hours. That ends up adding up to about 20 hours per month for 3 months. Overall, although the people really are very nice, the university has a very "grow your own" mentality in which most staff grew up in Cape, and have worked at SEMO their whole lives. Thus, the university is not very progressive and oftentimes the administration makes odd decisions based on lack of experience in other institutions other than SEMO.

job_title: Assistant Volleyball Coach in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: It was a very easy-going and relaxed working environment. Everyone got along and were very supportive of each other. I was given every opportunity to succeed and try different aspects of the job.
cons: It was a very easy-going and relaxed working environment. Sometimes too relaxed and things could get sloppy. It was easy to take advantage of the department being spread throughout campus and to neglect the work you were supposed to be doing.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Great students, good work life balance, decent benefits because of Mosers but they are below average when compared to other universities.
cons: Benefits continue to decline each year and are less than other universities.  The benefit package used to be a reason to work at SEMO, but not any more. Many of the managers are hired simply because they are already within the system.  Many of the internal processes are outdated and change is frowned upon. Pay is not competitive and raises are a joke.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros:

job_title: Professor in Cape Girardeau, MO
